biweekly.io

Class StreamReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • biweekly.io.StreamReader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ICalReader, JCalReader, XCalReader

    public abstract class StreamReader
extends Object
implements Closeable
    Parses iCalendar objects from a data stream.
    Author:
    Michael Angstadt

    • Constructor Detail

      • StreamReader

    • Method Detail

      • registerScribe

        public void registerScribe(ICalPropertyScribe<? extends ICalProperty> scribe)

        Registers an experimental property scribe. Can also be used to override the scribe of a standard property (such as DTSTART). Calling this method is the same as calling:

        getScribeIndex().register(scribe).

        Parameters:
        scribe - the scribe to register

      • registerScribe

        public void registerScribe(ICalComponentScribe<? extends ICalComponent> scribe)

        Registers an experimental component scribe. Can also be used to override the scribe of a standard component (such as VEVENT). Calling this method is the same as calling:

        getScribeIndex().register(scribe).

        Parameters:
        scribe - the scribe to register

      • getScribeIndex

        public ScribeIndex getScribeIndex()
        Gets the object that manages the component/property scribes.
        Returns:
        the scribe index

      • setScribeIndex

        public void setScribeIndex(ScribeIndex index)
        Sets the object that manages the component/property scribes.
        Parameters:
        index - the scribe index

      • getWarnings

        public List<ParseWarning> getWarnings()
        Gets the warnings from the last iCalendar object that was read.
        Returns:
        the warnings or empty list if there were no warnings

      • getDefaultTimezone

        public TimeZone getDefaultTimezone()
        Gets the timezone that will be used for parsing date property values that are floating or that have invalid timezone definitions assigned to them. Defaults to TimeZone.getDefault().
        Returns:
        the default timezone

      • setDefaultTimezone

        public void setDefaultTimezone(TimeZone defaultTimezone)
        Sets the timezone that will be used for parsing date property values that are floating or that have invalid timezone definitions assigned to them. Defaults to TimeZone.getDefault().
        Parameters:
        defaultTimezone - the default timezone

      • getGlobalTimezoneIdResolver

        public GlobalTimezoneIdResolver getGlobalTimezoneIdResolver()
        Gets the resolver that maps global timezone IDs to Java TimeZone objects. Defaults to DefaultGlobalTimezoneIdResolver.
        Returns:
        the resolver

      • setGlobalTimezoneIdResolver

        public void setGlobalTimezoneIdResolver(GlobalTimezoneIdResolver globalTimezoneIdResolver)
        Sets the resolver that maps global timezone IDs to Java TimeZone objects. Defaults to DefaultGlobalTimezoneIdResolver.
        Parameters:
        globalTimezoneIdResolver - the resolver

      • readAll

        public List<ICalendar> readAll()
                        throws IOException
        Reads all iCalendar objects from the data stream.
        Returns:
        the iCalendar objects
        Throws:
        IOException - if there's a problem reading from the stream

      • readNext

        public ICalendar readNext()
                   throws IOException
        Reads the next iCalendar object from the data stream.
        Returns:
        the next iCalendar object or null if there are no more
        Throws:
        IOException - if there's a problem reading from the stream

      • _readNext

        protected abstract ICalendar _readNext()
                                throws IOException
        Reads the next iCalendar object from the data stream.
        Returns:
        the next iCalendar object or null if there are no more
        Throws:
        IOException - if there's a problem reading from the stream
